summary: This is an email chain from June 2021 regarding the transfer of evidence from the '72 case' (likely referring to the 2008 Florida case against Jeffrey Epstein) to New York. The correspondence discusses coordinating the evidence and creating an index for production to the defense.

persons.name: Ic (USANYS)
persons.context: Recipient of an email regarding the arrival of evidence from the '72 case' and is asked to call to discuss.

events.title: Coordination of 72 Case Evidence Transfer
events.description: Email correspondence confirming the arrival of evidence from the '72 case' in New York and discussing the creation of an index for production to the defense.

events.title: Arrival of Florida Materials
events.description: Items from the '72 case' have arrived, as noted in a forwarded email.

keyFacts: Evidence from the '72 case', a reference to the 2008 Florida investigation/prosecution of Jeffrey Epstein, was transferred to New York by June 2021.
Prosecutors in New York were coordinating to produce an index of the evidence to the defense, indicating ongoing legal proceedings related to the Epstein case.
The email chain shows continued federal handling and disclosure of historical case materials years after the original Florida investigation.
